content.description: A longstanding project. Start with smears under the roof. Climb out through improbable Leavenworth style granite slopers to a 'thank god' crystal band jug. The grade on this is an estimate. It's too hard for me but I am pretty sure it goes; it will be classic when it does.

Sit start on the very cool knobby hold, then work your way out of the roof, left and up.

 Bullet rock, interesting features and movement as well as a zesty topout make this a real classic.

Arguably not a rock climb, but if it is, it is a contender for the worst boulder problem on Lemmon. That said, it is actually kind of fun if you happen to be waiting for your project to get some shade. Lay down start on sloper dish, core up, slap to some higher slopers and press it up. Actually pretty core intensive bc its so low. Lowballs are my friends.
content.location: In the stream bed next to the Zester

content.description: Sit-start on the obvious RH jug and the left hand pinch thing. Make some powerful moves up the steep compression prow and then maintain composure for the drawn out, easy, but dirty slab. Don't fall off the slab. That could be seriously bad.
content.location: Just below Neo and the Zester boulder.

content.description: Sit start on the very cool knob hold and climb up and right around the sloping arete. Top straight straight out. The movement on this is cryptic but excellent and the boulder isn't over until the mantel. Be weary. It was first ascended back to back (after many days of effort) with completely different beta for the crux. Get creative!
Amazing rock quality just down and to the left of the ACDC boulder.
